item.title: India Can Never Permit Others To Have Veto On Its Choices: S Jaishankar - NDTV
item.description:
Don't Confuse India's Independence With Neutrality: S Jaishankar

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar stated that India cannot permit others to decide its choices and emphasized the difference between independence and neutrality. He spoke of India's journey towards rediscovering its identity amidst global pressures.

  • Jaishankar stressed that India will act in its national interest without conforming to external pressures.
  • He highlighted India's exceptional status as a civilization state that can leverage its cultural strengths.
  • The Minister pointed to India's progress in addressing long-standing social issues such as poverty and discrimination.
"Independence should never be confused with neutrality. We will do whatever is right in our national interest and for global good without being intimidated to conform." - S Jaishankar

In conclusion, India is positioned at a critical juncture, balancing its national ambitions with its commitment to global well-being.

item.title: Delhi air pollution: AQI back to ‘severe’ as cold wave continues to grip national capital | Updates - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi air pollution: AQI back to ‘severe’ as cold wave continues to grip national capital

Date: Dec 22, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The air quality index (AQI) in Delhi has deteriorated back to the ‘severe’ category with a recorded AQI of 427, coinciding with a cold wave affecting the national capital.

  • Delhi’s AQI has dropped to 'severe' levels, significantly impacting health.
  • Minimum temperature recorded at 8 degrees Celsius on Sunday.
  • Cold wave has led to an increase in smog conditions in the city.
  • Health experts recommend staying indoors, particularly for vulnerable groups.
  • The 24-hour average on Saturday was 370, categorized as 'very poor'.
  • Air quality has become the worst since December 2021.
"People without roofs were seen taking shelter at camps and tents arranged for them in Delhi during the winter season."

This latest spike in pollution levels has raised concerns among health authorities and led to recommendations for minimizing outdoor activities.

item.title: CLAT 2025: Delhi High Court finds errors in 2 questions; orders NLU Consortium to revise the results - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Delhi High Court Orders Revision of CLAT 2025 Results Due to Question Errors

Date: Recent Source: Not specified

In a significant ruling, the Delhi High Court has found errors in two questions of the CLAT 2025 exam and ordered the National Law University (NLU) Consortium to revise the results. The Court emphasized that the corrections must benefit all candidates who selected the correct option as determined by the Court and the Expert Committee.

  • The Court directed the Consortium to extend the benefit to all candidates who selected option ‘C’ for question 14.
  • Question 100 was deemed erroneous and will be excluded from the evaluation.
  • The case was brought forth by a 17-year-old candidate, Aditya Singh, who claimed that his admission prospects were compromised due to the incorrect answer key.
  • Singh had submitted objections prior to the final answer key release, but claimed the Consortium failed to address them.
  • The Court highlighted the need for justice in cases of demonstrable errors in exam questions.
“Since Court has upheld option ‘C’ as the correct answer...benefit cannot be restricted only to the petitioner and will extend to all candidates who have opted for option ‘C’,”
“Question number 100 will be excluded...the result will be accordingly revised,”

In conclusion, this ruling underscores the importance of accuracy in examination processes and the duty of educational bodies to address grievances appropriately.

item.title: Thick Blanket Of Smog Grips Delhi, Mumbai As Air Quality Dips - NDTV
item.description:
Thick Blanket Of Smog Grips Delhi, Mumbai As Air Quality Dips

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

Delhi and Mumbai are experiencing a significant drop in air quality, with Delhi's Air Quality Index (AQI) at 386, categorized as 'very poor'. Meanwhile, Mumbai's AQI is at 176, categorized as 'moderate'. Cold wave conditions are exacerbating the smog.

  • Delhi's AQI has been at 'very poor' for two consecutive days.
  • The Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) has been re-imposed in Delhi, affecting schools and vehicle regulations.
  • Mumbai experiences its coldest winter in decades, contributing to air quality issues.
  • Social media shows citizens documenting worsening air conditions.
“Low visibility procedures are in progress at Delhi Airport. Passengers are requested to contact the airline concerned for updated flight information.” — Delhi Airport

The persistent smog and declining air quality in both cities are raising concerns about public health and safety.

item.title: Bihar Man Thrashed, Forced To Lick Spit. Cops File Case After Video Goes Viral - NDTV
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Bengaluru IT firm CEO, 5 kin killed as container truck falls on SUV - The Times of India
item.description:
Bengaluru IT firm CEO, 5 kin killed as container truck falls on SUV

Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

This tragic incident occurred when a container truck fell onto the SUV carrying a prominent IT firm CEO and his five family members, resulting in their deaths.

  • The CEO and five relatives were traveling in an SUV.
  • The accident involved a container truck, which collapsed on the vehicle.
  • The incident highlights concerns over road safety and heavy vehicle regulation.
“This is a shocking loss for the community and the tech industry.”

The loss of the CEO and his family members is a devastating event, raising awareness about traffic safety measures needed to prevent such incidents in the future.

item.title: Himachal Woman, 20, Dies In Mohali Building Collapse, Several Still Trapped - NDTV
item.description:
Himachal Woman, 20, Dies In Mohali Building Collapse, Several Still Trapped

Date: December 21, 2024

Source: New Delhi

A multi-agency rescue effort is underway after a four-storey building collapsed in Mohali, Punjab, resulting in the death of a 20-year-old woman identified as Drishti Verma from Himachal Pradesh.

  • Drishti was rescued from the rubble in critical condition but succumbed to her injuries.
  • At least five individuals are reported to be trapped in the debris.
  • Rescue teams from the Indian Army and the National Disaster Response Team (NDRF) are involved in operations.
  • The building reportedly collapsed due to excavation work on an adjacent plot.
  • Police have filed a case against the building owners for culpable homicide.
  • Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann is monitoring the rescue efforts.
“Sad news has been received that a multistorey building near Sohana in Sahibzada Ajit Singh Nagar (Mohali) has collapsed... We pray that there is no loss of life, we will also take action against the culprits.” - Bhagwant Mann

Officials have released a helpline number for assistance: 0172-2219506.

item.title: GST Council hikes tax on used, old EV cars by businesses; Opposition reacts - Hindustan Times
item.description:
GST Council hikes tax on used, old EV cars by businesses; Opposition reacts

Date: Dec 22, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Goods and Services Tax (GST) Council, led by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, has approved an increase of the tax rate on used electric vehicles sold by businesses from 12% to 18%. This decision aims to align used EV tax rates with those of non-electric vehicles.

  • The tax applies only to the margin value of sales by businesses.
  • Individual sellers remain exempt from this tax.
  • The decision faced criticism from opposition leaders, asserting it's unfavorable to the middle class.
  • Arvind Kejriwal criticized the move, stating it damages the aspirations of middle-class families.
  • Akhilesh Yadav accused the government of creating an uncertain business environment with frequent GST changes.
“Purchasing a car is a big deal for an ordinary middle-class family, but the central government is crushing their dreams...” - Arvind Kejriwal

The GST Council's decision reflects a broader strategy to regulate the used electric vehicle market in India, impacting businesses significantly while continuing to shield individual transactions.

item.title: When PM Modi Fulfilled A Special Request From 101-Year-Old IFS Officer’s Kin In Kuwait - News18
item.description:
PM Modi Meets 101-Year-Old IFS Officer in Kuwait

Date: December 22, 2024 Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi held an emotional meeting with 101-year-old IFS officer Mangal Sain Handa in Kuwait, after a request from Handa's family. The interaction was warmly received by the family and showcased the Prime Minister's engagement with the Indian diaspora.

  • Mangal Sain Handa served in various countries throughout his career, including Iraq, Kuwait, and China.
  • His granddaughter expressed gratitude to PM Modi for accommodating the meeting on social media.
  • The event highlighted Modi's connection with the common people through social media interactions.
  • Handa's family expressed deep appreciation for the Prime Minister's gesture.
“You’ve won our hearts once again…Mangal Sain Handa is overjoyed, and his smile means the world to us.” - Shreya Juneja

This encounter reflects PM Modi's ongoing effort to connect with people at a personal level while utilizing social media effectively.

item.title: Hindu right body puts up posters of Rahul Gandhi in Raebareli over Parliament scuffle - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Hindu Rights Body Criticizes Rahul Gandhi with Posters in Raebareli

Published on: 21 December 2024, Source: Local News

A Hindu rights organization has displayed posters of Rahul Gandhi in Raebareli, condemning his actions during a recent scuffle in Parliament.

  • The Vishwa Hindu Raksha Parishad has put up hoardings from the Churuva border to Raebareli district headquarters.
  • Rahul Singh, national general secretary, expressed his discontent over the treatment of an elderly MP during the Parliament incident.
  • Congress leaders, including district president Pankaj Tiwari, rebuffed accusations of violence against Gandhi, attributing them to political frustration.
  • Gandhi faced police action for his involvement in a Parliament scuffle that resulted in injuries to BJP MPs.
“Rahul Gandhi connected many people during the Bharat Jodo Yatra. This has been done only out of frustration and the people of the district know everything.” - Pankaj Tiwari

The incident highlights ongoing political tensions and the polarizing nature of contemporary Indian politics, with both parties seeking to leverage public sentiment.

item.title: Video: Car Flips 8 Times But Five Passengers Come Out Unscathed. Their Priority? Tea - News18
item.description:
Video: Car Flips 8 Times But Five Passengers Come Out Unscathed. Their Priority? Tea

Date: December 21, 2024, Source: News18

Five passengers were unhurt after their car flipped eight times in an accident on a highway in Rajasthan’s Nagaur. The accident was captured on CCTV which showed the car speeding on the highway.

  • The driver lost control while taking a turn, causing the vehicle to flip eight times.
  • In a miraculous escape, none of the five passengers sustained injuries.
  • After the accident, passengers entered a nearby car showroom and asked for tea.
“No one was hurt…not even a single scratch. As soon as they entered, they asked for tea.”

This incident underscores the unpredictability of road safety yet highlights a fortunate outcome for the passengers.

item.title: Fadnavis retains Home, Ajit Finance, Shinde gets Urban, Works, and Housing - The Indian Express
item.description:
Fadnavis Retains Home, Ajit Finance, Shinde Gets Urban, Works, and Housing

Publication Date: December 16, 2023

Source: Indian Express

In a recent cabinet reshuffle, Maharashtra's BJP-led government announced the allocation of ministerial portfolios, retaining significant positions amidst the recent elections.

  • Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis retains the Home Ministry and key departments such as Energy and Law & Judiciary.
  • Deputy CM Eknath Shinde receives Urban Development, Housing, and Public Works.
  • NCP Chief Ajit Pawar is allocated Finance & Planning along with State Excise.
  • The cabinet includes a total of 42 ministers following the induction of 39 new ministers on December 15, 2023.
“The portfolio allocation aims to ensure ministerial accountability after a strong electoral mandate.”

The reshuffle reflects a strategy to maintain effective governance while allowing opportunities for other party members in the future.

item.title: Maharashtra portfolio allocation: Devendra Fadnavis keeps home, Ajit finance, Shinde urban development, g - The Times of India
item.description:
Maharashtra portfolio allocation: Fadnavis retains home ministry, Ajit retains finance

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The recent allocation of portfolios in Maharashtra sees Devendra Fadnavis retaining the important home ministry, while Ajit Pawar takes over the finance department. Eknath Shinde has been assigned urban development, and the housing portfolio is also a crucial part of the new allocations.

  • Devendra Fadnavis remains the home minister.
  • Ajit Pawar has been given the finance portfolio.
  • Eknath Shinde is responsible for urban development.
  • The housing portfolio is now with Fadnavis.
“This allocation is essential for maintaining stability in the government and addressing the needs of the people.”

This allocation is set to impact the governance and service delivery in Maharashtra as the state navigates various challenges ahead.

item.title: Punjab civic polls: AAP wins in Patiala, leads in Jalandhar, Ludhiana; Congress ahead in Amritsar, Phagwara - The Hindu
item.description:
Punjab civic polls: AAP wins in Patiala, leads in Jalandhar, Ludhiana; Congress ahead in Amritsar, Phagwara

Published: December 22, 2024, Source: The Hindu

The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) emerged victorious in the Punjab municipal elections, winning Patiala and leading in Ludhiana and Jalandhar, while the Congress party held an advantage in Amritsar and Phagwara.

  • AAP won 43 out of 53 wards in Patiala and is set to elect its mayor.
  • In Ludhiana, AAP secured 42 out of 95 wards, while Congress won 29 wards.
  • AAP led in Jalandhar with 39 out of 85 wards, compared to Congress's 24 and BJP's 19.
  • Congress claimed 40 wards in Amritsar, leaving AAP with 28.
  • In Phagwara, Congress won 22 wards, emerging as the largest party.
  • AAP President Aman Arora claimed historic success, noting a win in over 50% of the 977 contested wards.
“This resounding victory is a testament to AAP's pro-people governance and commitment to transparent politics,” said AAP President Aman Arora.

The elections took place amid allegations of fake votes and opposition claims of electoral misconduct.

item.title: Siliguri Corridor Was On Busted Sleeper Cell’s Target, Reveals Probe Into Pan-India Operation - News18
item.description:
Siliguri Corridor Targeted by Busted Sleeper Cell, Probe Uncovers Pan-India Operation

Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: News18

The article reveals that a joint police operation arrested eight individuals, including a Bangladeshi national, aiming to disrupt plans associated with a sleeper cell linked to Al-Qaeda.

  • A sleeper cell operated in Assam, West Bengal, and Kerala.
  • The mastermind, Sad Radi, has connections with the Ansarullah Bangla Team (ABT).
  • The Siliguri Corridor is deemed a strategic target for terrorist activities.
  • Arrests occurred after meetings in Jalpaiguri and Falakata.
  • A 16 GB pen drive and suspicious documents were recovered from the suspects.
“This is a very well-coordinated operation and we are in touch with Assam police.” - IG STF Gaurav Sharma

The investigation highlights significant security concerns in light of geopolitical tensions and the strategic importance of the Siliguri Corridor.

item.title: Maharashtra portfolio allocation: Fadnavis keeps home | Full list of ministers - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Maharashtra Portfolio Allocation: CM Fadnavis Retains Home Department

Publication Date: Saturday | Source: Hindustan Times

Following more than two weeks since taking office, Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis announced the allocation of portfolios to his council of ministers. He has retained significant departments including Home, Energy, Law and Judiciary, and General Administration.

Key Points

  • Devendra Fadnavis retains the Home Department.
  • Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde receives Urban Development and Housing portfolios.
  • Ajit Pawar, NCP chief and Deputy Chief Minister, is assigned Finance and Planning.
  • Comprehensive list of ministers and their respective portfolios released.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

“This allocation will ensure effective governance and service delivery in Maharashtra,” Fadnavis stated during the press conference.

Overall, this portfolio allocation is essential in shaping the governance structure of Maharashtra under Fadnavis's leadership.

item.title: Delayed Exams, Holiday: Students Behind Bomb Threats To 3 Delhi Schools, Say Cops - NDTV
item.description:
Students Behind Bomb Threats to Three Delhi Schools, Police Say

Date: Not specified Source: NDTV

The Delhi Police have identified that bomb threats sent to three schools were orchestrated by the students themselves, who sought to postpone exams. The police have conducted counseling and warned the parents of the involved students.

  • Three Delhi schools received bomb threat emails linked to their own students.
  • The students sent the emails to postpone exams after a recent explosion in Rohini.
  • The police declared the threats as hoaxes after investigations.
  • Over 100 bomb threats have targeted Delhi schools in the past 11 days.
“The emails were sent through a VPN, making it difficult to trace the perpetrators.”

This situation highlights a concerning trend of students resorting to bomb threats as a means of manipulating school schedules.

item.title: Maharashtra portfolios: Fadnavis keeps Home, Shinde Urban Development; Ajit gets Finance - The Hindu
item.description:
Maharashtra portfolios: Fadnavis keeps Home, Shinde Urban Development; Ajit gets Finance

Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis retains key portfolios while Deputy Chief Ministers Eknath Shinde and Ajit Pawar take on Urban Development and Finance, respectively.

  • Fadnavis retains Home, Law and Judiciary departments.
  • Shinde gets Urban Development along with Housing and Public Works.
  • Ajit Pawar continues with Finance and Planning, including State Excise.
  • Ministers reshuffled, with new opportunities for younger leaders.
“Young faces have been given an opportunity in this cabinet.”

This cabinet reshuffle aims to balance power among coalition partners, maintaining crucial departments and preparing for the upcoming BMC elections.

item.title: GST council explains difference in tax rates between salted and caramel popcorn - Hindustan Times
item.description:
GST Council Clarifies Tax Rates for Salted and Caramel Popcorn

Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The GST Council has issued a clarification on the tax rates applicable to different types of popcorn, specifying that pre-packed salted popcorn will incur a lower tax rate than caramelized popcorn.

  • Pre-packed, labelled, ready-to-eat snacks are taxed at 12%.
  • Caramelized popcorn falls under a higher tax category at 18% due to its added sugar content.
  • The Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) will release a circular to clarify these rules further.
  • Ready-to-eat popcorn not pre-packed has a 5% GST rate.
  • Black pepper and raisins supplied directly by farmers are exempt from GST.
“Salted, caramelised, plain popcorn is being sold as namkeen in certain states. Caramelised popcorn comes with added sugar, so the treatment rate is different from namkeen.” - Nirmala Sitharaman

The GST Council continues to review other tax issues without making definitive decisions, highlighting ongoing discussions about the applicability of GST on food delivery services.

item.title: PM Modi meets 101-year-old ex-IFS officer in Kuwait after granddaughter's request - Hindustan Times
item.description:
PM Modi Meets 101-Year-Old Ex-IFS Officer in Kuwait Following Granddaughter's Request

Date: Dec 21, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi met a 101-year-old former Indian Foreign Service (IFS) officer in Kuwait after a request from his granddaughter made on social media.

  • PM Modi responded to a request from Mangal Sain Handa's granddaughter on platform X for a meeting during his visit.
  • This visit marks the first by an Indian PM to Kuwait in 43 years.
  • Mangal Sain Handa's son expressed gratitude for the meeting, describing it as an "experience of a lifetime."
  • Kuwait's Indian diaspora constitutes 21% of the population, with Indian workers making up 30% of the workforce.
“We deeply value the historical connection with Kuwait that has been nurtured over generations.” - PM Modi

This personal meeting highlights the relationship between India and Kuwait, especially within the context of a substantial Indian community in the Gulf state.

item.title: Telangana not to allow benefit shows of movies.. - Greatandhra
item.description:
Telangana Bans Benefit Shows and Actor Theatre Visits Following Stampede Incident

Publication Date: [Insert Date] Source: [Insert Source]

In response to a tragic stampede during the premiere of "Pushpa 2" in Hyderabad, the Telangana government has announced a ban on actor visits to theatres and benefit shows for upcoming movie releases.

  • The government, led by Cinematography Minister Komatireddy Venkat Reddy, will not allow actor visits and benefit shows.
  • While they are suspending these events, they will continue to offer special incentives for the film industry.
  • After the incident that resulted in a death and injuries, the state will not increase cinema ticket prices but will consider them on a case-by-case basis.
  • Actor Allu Arjun did not meet the family of the deceased and was criticized for attending the event without police permission.
  • The government has pledged to pay Rs 25 lakh to the family of the deceased and continue to assist the injured child.
  • The Chief Minister condemned the lack of support from other film personalities for the victims.
“I assure that we will do everything possible to save the boy’s life,” said Minister Venkat Reddy regarding the injured child.

The government's actions reflect concern for public safety and a commitment to support families affected by the incident.

item.title: Bengaluru Accident: CCTV Footage Shows Container Truck Toppling Over SUV Killing Family In Nelamangala Highway - Oneindia
item.description:
Tragic Bengaluru Accident: Container Truck Topples Over SUV, Killing Family

Published: Saturday, December 21, 2024, 21:44 [IST] Source: Oneindia News

A horrific accident on the Bengaluru-Tumakuru highway resulted in the death of six family members, including a notable tech industry leader, when a speeding container truck toppled over their SUV.

  • The victims include Chandram Yegapagol, the Managing Director of IAST Software Solutions, and five family members.
  • The incident occurred near Nelamangala during their journey to Maharashtra for Christmas celebrations.
  • CCTV footage reveals the speeding container lorry losing control and crashing onto the SUV.
  • The tragedy has sparked an outpouring of grief within the tech community and raised concerns about road safety.
“The CCTV footage highlights the container lorry's high speed and sudden loss of control, showcasing the gravity of the incident.”

This tragic event underscores the need for improved traffic safety measures and has left an indelible impact on the affected community.

item.title: Gurugram Boy, 12, Wants Online Classes, Sends Bomb Threat To School - NDTV
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Shark Tank's Namita Thapar And Anupam Mittal Clash Over 70-Hour Workweek Debate - NDTV
item.description:
Shark Tank's Namita Thapar And Anupam Mittal Clash Over 70-Hour Workweek Debate

Publication Date: November 14, 2023

Source: Undisclosed

This article discusses the ongoing debate about work hours in India, sparked by comments from Infosys founder NR Narayana Murthy regarding a 70-hour workweek. Judges from 'Shark Tank India', Namita Thapar and Anupam Mittal, share their contrasting views on the subject.

  • Anupam Mittal believes that productivity cannot be measured by hours worked.
  • Namita Thapar argues for reasonable work limits for regular employees to protect their health and well-being.
  • Thapar highlights the disparity between high-level stakeholders and regular employees regarding workload expectations.
  • The debate was reignited by Narayana Murthy's call for increased productivity among India's youth.
Anupam Mittal: "I think it is a big lie... you are not going to achieve anything extraordinary in life by counting the hours that you are putting in."
Namita Thapar: "Basically this whole discussion... is a crock of bullsh*t."

In conclusion, the debate raises important questions about work-life balance and the implications of excessive work hours on health and family life.

item.title: Maharashtra portfolio allocation: CM Fadnavis keeps home ministry, Ajit Pawar gets finance, Shinde gets u - The Times of India
item.description:
Maharashtra portfolio allocation: CM Fadnavis keeps home ministry, Ajit Pawar gets finance, Shinde gets urban development

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

This article discusses the recent allocation of ministerial portfolios in Maharashtra, where Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis retains control of the Home Ministry while Ajit Pawar is assigned the Finance portfolio, and Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde takes charge of Urban Development.

  • Devendra Fadnavis retains the Home Ministry.
  • Ajit Pawar appointed as Finance Minister.
  • Eknath Shinde to oversee Urban Development.
  • The allocation reflects the power dynamics within the coalition government.
“The allocation of portfolios is crucial for the functioning of the government and its future plans,” commented a political analyst.

The announcement of the ministerial allocations marks a significant step in establishing the governance structure in Maharashtra following the recent political shifts.

item.title: Maharashtra portfolio allocation: Fadnavis keeps Home Ministry, Shinde gets Urban Development in new Cabinet - India TV News
item.description:
Maharashtra portfolio allocation

Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: India TV

Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis has allocated portfolios to his council of ministers, keeping the critical Home department while Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde is assigned to Urban Development.

  • 39 ministers were sworn in on December 15, 2024.
  • The BJP, NCP, and Shiv Sena coalition (Mahayuti) won 230 out of 288 seats in the November assembly elections.
  • Fadnavis also manages Energy, Law and Judiciary, and Information and Publicity.
"Fadnavis retains Home department while Eknath Shinde takes charge of Urban Development."

This allocation follows a week-long winter session of the state Legislature.
